p: China is one of the 22 countries characterized as having a severe TB epidemic, ranking the second after India. There are 1.3 million patients diagnosed with a TB infection, comprising up to 14.3% of the global incidence and 80% of which are from rural areas, especially the northwest part of China where the economy is least developed [ 29]. The MDR-TB epidemic in China is very severe and accounts for 1/4â€“1/3 of the global incidence and is listed by WHO as one of the countries/regions requiring special attention [ 30]. All drugs available for MDR or XDR TB (extensively drug-resistant tuberculosis) are brand drugs manufactured by the big pharmaceutical companies in developed countries.
